Description.87: Manchester United superstar Cristiano Ronaldo scored his 806th career goal in Old Trafford on Saturday, breaking FIFA's all-time record for most goals in competitive matches in men's football history.
Description.95: Andriy Yarmolenko sank to his knees and buried his face in his hands, overcome with emotion after scoring the opening goal in West Ham's 2-1 Premier League win over Aston Villa.
Description.293: There hasn't been much to shout about at Manchester United over the last few years.
Description.296: Lyon stunned Manchester City on Saturday to qualify for the semifinals of the Champions League, winning 3-1.
Description.297: American youngster Tyler Adams scored a late winner to fire RB Leipzig past Atletico Madrid and into the Champions League semifinals on Thursday.
Description.300: US international Reggie Cannon has described the booing of players who took a knee during the national anthem before a Major League Soccer match as "absolutely disgusting."
Description.302: Borussia Dortmund says youngster Jadon Sancho will remain at the club next season after Manchester United was reportedly close to signing the starlet.
Description.769: Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford has become the latest football player to receive racist abuse online and described the incident as "humanity and social media at its worst."
Description.782: Liverpool showed glimpses of last season's title-winning pedigree to return to winning ways on Thursday, beating Jose Mourinho's Tottenham Hotspur 3-1 in the Premier League.
Description.788: A crazy Premier League season went up a whole level of craziness on Wednesday.
Description.839: Liverpool lost its first Premier League home game in almost four years as relegation-threatened Burnley pulled off a stunning upset to end Jurgen Klopp's 68-game unbeaten run at Anfield.
Description.877: The 2020-2021 Premier League season is a proving a bumper campaign for penalties.
Description.907: Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer says his team will do its best to keep within the new Covid-19 guidelines as the Premier League looks to clampdown on celebrations.
Description.955: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp took a swipe at Manchester United's penalty record and fanned the flames of a potential title race after his side lost 1-0 to Southampton on Monday.
Description.970: Manchester City shrugged off the loss of six players to Covid-19 to beat Chelsea 3-1 on Sunday to reignite its English Premier League title challenge.
Description.976: The owner of an English Premier League team has defended a post from the club's official Twitter account that led to online abuse being directed at football pundit Karen Carney.
Description.978: Manchester United drew level with archrival Liverpool on points at the top of the English Premier League as a sweetly struck Bruno Fernandes penalty secured a 2-1 victory over Aston Villa at Old Trafford.
Description.986: Throughout his coaching career, Eddie Jones has heeded advice he was given by former Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson.
Description.1003: In a match that was largely low on quality, it was a standout moment of brilliance that eventually gave Real Madrid a narrow 1-0 win over 10-man Atalanta in the Champions League round of 16.
Description.1006: Former Arsenal star Thierry Henry is stepping down as head coach of Major League Soccer (MLS) side CF Montreal due to family reasons.
Description.1010: Already in a league of their own when it comes to sustainability in sport, innovative English soccer club Forest Green Rovers will trial a kit made from coffee bean waste on Saturday.
Description.1034: Yan Dhanda has been a leading light in helping Swansea City return to the Premier League, but he is also driven by the fact he's one of only a handful of British Asian footballers playing professionally in the United Kingdom.
Description.1044: A superb Bruno Fernandes once again inspired Manchester United to victory Thursday as the Premier League side took full control of its Europa League round of 32 tie against Real Sociedad.
Description.1085: Manchester United forward Anthony Martial has received racial abuse over social media following his side's 1-1 draw with West Bromwich Albion on Sunday.
Description.1093: Liverpool's defense of its Premier League title is rapidly evaporating after yet another calamitous defensive performance condemned Jurgen Klopp's side to a third consecutive defeat.
Description.1141: Talk about a roller-coaster performance -- Ilkay Gundogan provided the dictionary definition on Sunday for Manchester City against Liverpool.
Description.1169: Liverpool's bid to retain the English Premier League title slipped further from its grip on Wednesday after suffering a shock defeat to relegation-threatened Brighton.
Description.1173: Manchester United thrashed Southampton 9-0 in the Premier League on Tuesday, the second time in as many years that Saints have been on the losing end of a record-equaling scoreline.
Description.1179: Stuart Baxter has been sacked from his position as manager by Indian Super League club Odisha after making comments about rape during a post-match interview.
Description.1205: Sergio Aguero will leave Manchester City when his contract expires at the end of the season, the club has announced.
Description.1217: Before there was Marcus Rashford, there was another notable Manchester United humanitarian, Lou Macari.
Description.1280: Paul Stewart played for the England international team and some of English football's leading clubs, notably Manchester City, Tottenham Hotspur and Liverpool.
Description.1284: It's crunch time in the Champions League.
Description.1288: Manager Jose Mourinho questioned Tottenham Hotspur's "attitude" after defeat by Dinamo Zagreb in the Europa League, while captain Hugo Lloris said the team's performance was a "disgrace."
Description.1299: Since hanging up his running spikes in 2017, Olympic legend Usain Bolt has enjoyed plenty more free time being able to watch his beloved Manchester United.
Description.1305: The Manchester City winning machine just keeps rolling on.
Description.1337: Tottenham's Erik Lamela produced an outrageous piece of skill to score a rabona goal but was later sent off in the North London Derby, as Arsenal beat its rivals 2-1 on Sunday in the Premier League.
Description.1366: Cristiano Ronaldo's "unforgivable error" in extra-time against 10-man Porto in the Champions League proved decisive as Juventus was dumped out by the Portuguese side.
Description.1409: Manchester United ended Manchester City's 21-game winning streak with a brilliantly executed 2-0 victory at the Etihad Stadium on Sunday.
Description.1417: Maia Chaka will make history when the new National Football League season starts this year.
Description.1424: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp has vowed to be "as honest as possible" with his players after a 1-0 loss against Chelsea -- his side's fifth consecutive home defeat.
Description.1452: The owners of Jiangsu FC, the defending Chinese Super League (CSL) champion, announced on Sunday that the club would "cease operations" with immediate effect.
Description.1485: Christian Pulisic became the first US Men's National Team player to score in a Champions League semifinal, as Chelsea and Real Madrid played out an entertaining 1-1 draw in Tuesday's first leg.
Description.1505: Manchester City clinched a fourth consecutive League Cup title on Sunday after beating Tottenham Hotspur 1-0 at Wembley.
Description.1517: Former Manchester United star Ryan Giggs, who is the manager of the Welsh national football team, has been charged with assaulting two women and "coercive and controlling behaviour," police said on Friday.
Description.1523: Ten of the 12 founding members might have officially pulled out of the European Super League, but Barcelona has reiterated its commitment to the idea.
Description.1534: One by one they began to fall. The European Super League looks to have collapsed.
Description.1535: The architects of the European Super League appeared to strike a defiant tone Tuesday, promising to "reshape the project" following the withdrawal of all six English clubs from the controversial breakaway competition.
Description.1536: Less than 48 hours after the formation of a new European Super League, several English clubs have already withdrawn from the controversial competition.
Description.1539: Twelve elite football clubs intent on forming a new European Super League are facing a concerted backlash from the sport's governing bodies over their plan.
Description.1544: Football fans, politicians and governing bodies are united in fury after 12 of the sport's biggest teams announced plans to breakaway from European football competitions and form their own "Super League" -- a move that poses an existential threat to the world's favorite sport.
Description.1545: Players and fans of Liverpool and Leeds United took a stand against the European Super League, the controversial competition that is expected to change the face of football, during the sides' Premier League game on Monday.
Description.1550: Football fan groups have reacted angrily to the prospect of the European Super League, calling it the "ultimate betrayal" and "cynical greed."
Description.1551: José Mourinho has been sacked by English Premier League club Tottenham Hotspur after just 17 months in charge, the club announced in a statement on Monday.
Description.1553: For the first time in six seasons, there will be a new Women's Champions League winner.
Description.1554: UEFA president Aleksander Ceferin says the "shameless" plans for a new European Super League (ESL) are akin to "taking football hostage."
Description.1558: The news of plans for 12 of Europe's top football teams to break away and form a European Super League has shocked and outraged the footballing and wider world.
Description.1581: Liverpool has condemned "a few individuals" for their "shameful behavior" after fans smashed a window of the Real Madrid team bus ahead of the Champions League quarterfinal on Wednesday.
Description.1593: Slavia Prague defender Ondřej Kúdela has been banned for 10 matches by UEFA after the governing body's investigation into allegations of the player's "racist behavior" towards Rangers' midfielder Glen Kamara during the sides' UEFA Europa League meeting at Ibrox stadium last month.
Description.1595: Mehdi Taremi scored a truly spectacular overhead kick on Tuesday to become the first Iranian player to score in the Champions League quarterfinals.
Description.1615: Tottenham Hotspur has condemned the "abhorrent" online abuse directed at star player Son Heung-Min after the side's 3-1 Premier League defeat by Manchester United on Sunday.
Description.1626: Two goals from Stuart Dallas saw Leeds United secure an unlikely 2-1 victory against Premier League leader Manchester City, despite having captain Liam Cooper sent off in the first half.
Description.1667: Real Madrid overpowered Liverpool 3-1 in the first leg of the sides' Champions League quarterfinal on Tuesday, while Borussia Dortmund was left frustrated by a disallowed goal in its 2-1 defeat to Manchester City.
Description.1676: Rebecca Welch made history on Monday as she became the first appointed female referee to take charge of an English Football League (EFL) game.
Description.1697: The contest for the Premier League's Champions League qualification places got a whole lot more interesting on Saturday after 10-man Chelsea were surprisingly beaten 5-2 at home by relegation-threatened West Bromwich Albion.
Description.1718: In the end, it was the result no Manchester United fan wanted.
Description.1725: Manchester City stars Raheem Sterling and Kyle Walker both received racist messages on Instagram after losing 1-0 to Chelsea in the Champions League final on Saturday.
Description.1731: Chelsea clinched the Champions League title on Saturday after beating Manchester City 1-0 in the all-English final.
Description.1741: As well as being a superstar for Manchester United and England, Marcus Rashford is using his platform to help others less fortunate than him.
Description.1750: Forward Marcus Rashford has said he has received "at least 70 racial slurs" on social media following Manchester United's Europa League defeat to Villarreal on Wednesday.
Description.1751: Ahead of unquestionably the biggest game in the club's history, Manchester City's players seem calm and composed.
Description.1753: Villarreal won its first major European trophy after defeating Manchester United in a marathon penalty shootout in the UEFA Europa League final.
Description.1754: UEFA has opened disciplinary proceedings against Real Madrid, Barcelona and Juventus after the teams' involvement in the European Super League.
Description.1779: English Premier League side Wolverhampton Wanderers has apologized to former Manchester United and England defender Rio Ferdinand after police arrested a man for racially abusing him during a match on Sunday.
Description.1837: Chelsea manager Emma Hayes says winning the club's first Women's Champions League would be an "incredible achievement," but insists success is also about inspiring the next generation of young girls.
Description.1845: After postponing the original fixture between Manchester United and Liverpool with their protests, United fans once again voiced their opposition to the club's owners on Thursday at the rearranged fixture between the two Premier League rivals.
Description.1853: The Champions League final between Manchester City and Chelsea is to be played in Porto instead of Istanbul, European football's governing body UEFA said on Thursday.
Description.1858: In 1998, two years after Nedum Onuoha joined Manchester City's academy, the club he supported was relegated to the third tier of English football.
Description.1866: It's a country that takes the issue of equality seriously, and now the top division of women's football in Finland -- the National League -- is to offer hijabs to any player that wants one.
Description.1868: Manchester City can finally celebrate becoming the new English Premier League champion after fierce rivals Manchester United lost to Leicester City 2-1 on Tuesday.
Description.1872: Former Manchester City star Nedum Onuoha says social media companies have been doing the "bare minimum" to protect players from online racist abuse.
Description.1881: For the first time in 19 years, Cristiano Ronaldo could miss out on playing in the Champions League.
Description.1901: European football's governing body, UEFA, says nine of the 12 founding clubs that formed the ill-fated breakaway Super League competition have recommitted to UEFA club and national team competitions.
Description.1908: Arsenal's semifinal exit to Villarreal in the Europa League was an "embarrassment" according to former captain Martin Keown.
Description.1913: You might gawk at Premier League footballers' million dollar salaries but playing careers are short and can sometimes be curtailed by injury, illness or poor form.
Description.1916: Chelsea ensured it will be an all English affair in the Champions League final this season after beating Real Madrid in the semifinals on Wednesday.
Description.1920: They are the US billionaire owners of multiple sports teams, but you don't often see the likes of Arsenal's Stan Kroenke, Liverpool's John W. Henry and the Glazer family, which runs Manchester United, popping into the stadiums of their clubs to watch the teams they bought.
Description.1925: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola praised the club's "incredible" journey after it reached the Champions League final for the first time.
Description.1933: Sapir Berman made sports history on Monday, officiating at a soccer match in Israel's Premier League for the first time since coming out as transgender.
Description.1939: A marquee English Premier League game was postponed on Sunday after hundreds of Manchester United fans, protesting against the club's US owners, invaded the pitch at its Old Trafford stadium ahead of the match against Liverpool.
Description.2013: There have now been seven no-hitters thrown this 2021 Major League Baseball season -- tying the modern-era record.
Description.2175: The English Premier League outlined on Wednesday sanctions for the six clubs -- Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool, Manchester City, Manchester United and Tottenham -- involved in the breakaway Super League that was announced in April.
Description.2384: An English Premier League club has suspended a member of its first team squad after he was arrested on suspicion of child sex offenses.
Description.2554: Earlier this month, Olivia Moultrie, a 15-year-old soccer player from California, was granted permission by a federal judge to sign with a National Women's Soccer League (NWSL) club after ruling that the league can't enforce its age rule requiring players to be at least 18 to sign a professional contract with one of the league's clubs.
Description.2572: Manchester City put on a stunning display to thrash Arsenal 5-0 at the Etihad Stadium on Saturday, dropping the Gunners to the bottom of the Premier League table with their third consecutive loss.
Description.2588: Manchester City defender Benjamin Mendy has been remanded in custody after appearing in court on Friday, charged with four counts of rape and one count of sexual assault.
Description.2590: Cristiano Ronaldo is set to re-sign for Manchester United subject to personal terms, visa and a medical assessment, the club announced on Friday.
Description.2595: Manchester City defender Benjamin Mendy has been charged by the Cheshire Constabulary with four counts of rape and one count of sexual assault.
Description.2596: Manchester City suffered a double blow on Wednesday as manager Pep Guardiola said he plans to leave the club in 2023 as Spurs striker Harry Kane announced he is staying at the London team.
Description.2603: The Premier League says its clubs have "reluctantly but unanimously" decided not to release players for matches in countries on the UK's red-list for the upcoming international break next month.
Description.2625: A top-flight French league game between Nice and Marseille was abandoned on Sunday after fans invaded the pitch and a mass brawl broke out, involving players and staff.
Description.2637: Diogo Jota and Sadio Mane scored Liverpool's goals in the 2-0 Premier League win over Burnley, but it was the performance of teenager Harvey Elliott that really caught the eye on Saturday.
Description.2660: No Harry Kane? No problem. Tottenham Hotspur stunned Manchester City on Sunday, grinding out a gritty 1-0 win, despite the absence of the London's club star striker, who has been linked with a move to the reigning Premier League champion.
Description.2671: The modern-era record in Major League Baseball for most no-hitters thrown in a season was broken on Saturday in a sensational way, as a pitcher achieved the feat in his first career big league start.
Description.2674: Hundreds of thousands of fans attended English Premier League matches this weekend for the first time in nearly 18 months, though one game was marred by homophobic chanting and another by "isolated incidents of disorder" ahead of kick off.
Description.2678: Manchester United paraded new signing Raphaël Varane before its match against Leeds United at Old Trafford on Saturday and then treated the French international to an impressive win in its first match of the new Premier League season.
Description.2679: The reviews are in for Arsenal's performance against Brentford in the English Premier League's opening match on Friday and they make for grim reading if you're a Gunners fan.
Description.2683: It wasn't that long ago that six of the English Premier League's biggest teams -- Liverpool, Chelsea, Manchester United, Manchester City, Arsenal and Tottenham -- sparked outrage for signing up to the proposed European Super League (ESL).
Description.2690: Around the age of 16, I arrived at an uncomfortable conclusion: As a Manchester United fan from London, I was among the most hated demographics in English football.
Description.2728: The NBA Summer League game between the Washington Wizards and Indiana Pacers has been postponed due to the league's health and safety protocols.
Description.2758: English Premier League champion Manchester City completed the signing of England international Jack Grealish​ on a six-year contract on Thursday.
Description.2812: Cristiano Ronaldo scored a dramatic 95th minute goal to rescue Manchester United and beat Villarreal 2-1 on Wednesday in the Champions League.
Description.2830: If you thought the idea of a European football Super League was dead and buried, then think again.
Description.2841: Tottenham's fall from 2019 Champions League finalists to a comprehensive 3-1 drubbing by Arsenal show how much the club has regressed.
Description.2881: In an exclusive interview with CNN Sport, Chelsea striker Romelu Lukaku has urged the CEOs of social media companies to sit down with leading Premier League stars to try and put an end to the abuse that footballers receive online.
Description.2921: Australian Jarred Gillett will become the first overseas referee to officiate a Premier League match when he takes charge of Watford's home match against Newcastle United at Vicarage Road on Saturday.
Description.2945: Tottenham Hotspur hopes to end Sunday's Premier League game against Chelsea on zero -- not zero goals or shots on target, but zero carbon emissions.
Description.2953: Police made multiple arrests following a fight among fans at Leicester City's Europa League clash against Napoli on Thursday.
Description.2985: It took Cristiano Ronaldo less than 13 minutes to score on his second Champions League debut for Manchester United, opening the scoring against Swiss team Young Boys.
Description.3009: Cristiano Ronaldo scored two goals during his first game back at Manchester United on Saturday against Newcastle United in the Premier League.
Description.3025: French football club Nice has been handed a two-point penalty, one of which is suspended, and ordered to replay its league match against Marseille after their game was abandoned on August 22.
Description.3090: Crystal Palace forward Wilfried Zaha says he was targeted with racist abuse on social media, following his side's 2-0 win against Manchester City on Saturday.
Description.3092: National Hockey League Commissioner Gary Bettman spoke with Kyle Beach, a former NHL player who said he was sexually assaulted by former Chicago Blackhawks video coach Brad Aldrich in 2010, on ways the league can better protect players, according to NHL.com.
Description.3113: The National Women's Soccer League Players Association said Friday the league has agreed to meet all the players demands for cultural changes and transparency following allegations of sexual misconduct that rattled the league earlier this month.
Description.3132: Australian professional footballer Josh Cavallo announced on Wednesday that he is gay in a video message released by his A-League club Adelaide United.
Description.3143: Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer will remain in his post despite Sunday's 5-0 hammering at the hands of Liverpool in their English Premier League encounter at Old Trafford.
Description.3152: Carl Madsen, a National Football League veteran official, died Sunday on his way home from the Kansas City Chiefs and Tennessee Titans game in Nashville, the league told CNN. He was 71.
Description.3156: Walter Smith, who guided Scottish club Rangers to 10 league titles, has died at the age of 73.
Description.3157: It is a day that Manchester United fans would rather soon forget.
Description.3179: Very few people would have given Norwich hope of avoid a record-extending sixth relegation from the Premier League before the season had even begun, but that number is likely to now be zero.
Description.3197: The National Football League and lawyers for Black players who accused the league of discrimination have filed a joint proposal to "scrap the use of a race-based method to evaluate dementia claims made by former players in the league's concussion settlement," according to a New York Times report.
Description.3199: The National Women's Soccer League (NWSL) has agreed in principle on how to handle the changes that are being demanded by players after allegations of sexual misconduct engulfed the league, interim CEO Marla Messing said on Wednesday.
Description.3216: Liverpool narrowly edged past 10-man Atletico Madrid in an all-time classic Champions League encounter, as the two sides shared five goals in the Spanish capital.
Description.3221: Cristiano Ronaldo scored a late winning goal to complete a stunning Manchester United comeback against Atalanta in the Champions League.
Description.3227: Manager Steve Bruce has left Newcastle United by mutual consent just 13 days after the Saudi Arabia-backed takeover of the Premier League club.
Description.3244: Sixty-eight percent of English Premier League players have been fully vaccinated and 81% of players have received at least one Covid-19 vaccination dose, the league announced in a statement on Tuesday.
Description.3265: The Premier League match between Newcastle and Tottenham Hotspur was suspended in the 41st minute on Sunday due to a "medical issue" in the crowd, the league wrote on Twitter.
Description.3274: The pressure on Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer was ratcheted up a few notches on Saturday afternoon as his side lost 4-2 to Leicester City in the Premier League.
Description.3279: Mohamed Salah scored his second wonderful solo goal in as many Premier League games as Liverpool spoilt Claudio Ranieri's return to management in the UK.
Description.3280: Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford has been advised by his manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer to "focus on football" rather than off-field commitments as he gets set to return to play from injury.
Description.3340: France came from behind to defeat Spain and claim the UEFA Nations League on Sunday thanks to goals from Karim Benzema and Kylian Mbappé.
Description.3348: While the likes of the NFL are leading the way in public vaccine advocacy and transparency -- the league said it had reached a vaccination rate of over 90% among players by late September -- the uptake among footballers in the English Premier League remains shrouded in mystery.
Description.3351: Pride in Football, the alliance of LGBT+ supporters' groups in Britain, criticised Newcastle United's takeover by a Saudi Arabia-led consortium and called for reforms to the Premier League's owners' and directors' test.
Description.3365: France completed a famous comeback against Belgium on Thursday, overcoming a two-goal deficit to win 3-2 and reach the final of the UEFA Nations League.
Description.3368: A federal judge in Nevada has recommended that the rape case involving Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo be dismissed.
Description.3371: Players from the National Women's Soccer League stopped play during the sixth minute in the first matches scheduled Wednesday night and joined together at center circle in solidarity for a minute.
Description.3376: Not long after his transfer from Sporting to Manchester United, it quickly became apparent that Bruno Fernandes was the Premier League club's most influential player.
Description.3379: A Saudi Arabian-backed takeover of Newcastle United has been agreed, the Premier League and the club announced on Thursday.
Description.3389: Former National Women's Soccer League (NWSL) player Mana Shim has accused former coach Paul Riley of being a "predator" who "sexually harassed" her.
Description.3390: With another round of international matches looming in the football calendar, questions about players being released to represent their countries remain a headache for the Premier League.
Description.3393: Former Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson said Cristiano Ronaldo should have started last weekend's 1-1 home draw with Everton instead of being brought on as a second-half substitute by current boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.
Description.3404: German soccer club Union Berlin has apologized after anti-Semitic incidents were reported during the UEFA Europa Conference League match against Israeli team Maccabi Haifa on Thursday.
Description.3407: Former Manchester United player Park Ji-sung has asked fans to stop singing a famous chant about him which makes reference to Koreans eating dog meat.
Description.3409: Claudio Ranieri has been appointed as the new manager of English Premier League club Watford on a two-year contract.
Description.3412: Liverpool and Manchester City played out an exhilarating 2-2 draw in the Premier League on Sunday, in a match which saw Mohamed Salah score a magical solo goal.
Description.3418: On Sunday, Boris Johnson will walk among his Conservative faithful for the first time since October 2019, as members of the UK's governing party gather in the English city of Manchester for their 2021 conference.
Description.3422: The commissioner of the National Women's Soccer League has resigned and the league has called off all matches scheduled for this weekend following a report by The Athletic detailing allegations of sexual coercion and misconduct against Paul Riley, who coached three NWSL franchises over eight seasons.
Description.3423: This time there was no late intervention from Cristiano Ronaldo as Manchester United drew 1-1 with Everton at Old Trafford.
Description.3430: Ukrainian hockey authorities have been widely criticized for the lenient punishment it handed out to one of the league's players for performing a racist gesture.
Description.3434: Former English Premier League referee Mark Clattenburg has been criticized for making "outdated" comments about female referees.
Description.3437: Steven Gerrard, manager of Scottish football team, Rangers, says he's "not surprised" Sparta Prague fans booed Glen Kamara during their 1-0 defeat in the Europa League on Thursday.
Description.3441: The National Women's Soccer League team North Carolina Courage fired head coach Paul Riley on Thursday afternoon following accusations of sexual coercion and misconduct by former players who were coached by him.
Description.3453: Former Egypt international Mohamed Aboutrika has described homosexuality as a "dangerous ideology" amid an English Premier League initiative championing LGBTQ+ inclusion.
Description.3457: Fenway Sports Group (FSG), which owns Major League Baseball's Boston Red Sox and English Premier League team Liverpool, has reached an agreement to acquire controlling interest of the National Hockey League's Pittsburgh Penguins.
Description.3463: Cristiano Ronaldo's benching in Manchester United's 1-1 draw against Chelsea on Sunday prompted a fierce debate between leading pundits Jamie Carragher and Roy Keane.
Description.3464: Manchester United has announced Ralf Rangnick as the club's interim manager until the end of the season.
Description.3474: Midfielder Jorginho went from zero to hero as Chelsea and Manchester United played out a pulsating 1-1 draw on Sunday in the Premier League.
Description.3482: It was Premier League club Newcastle United's first match of a new era. St. James' Park was packed to capacity with expectant fans and the sound of jubilant chants filled the air on the Tyneside on Sunday, October 17th.
Description.3483: After playing 13 Premier League games, Newcastle United still haven't won a match, the club's latest setback coming in Saturday's 2-0 defeat by Arsenal.
Description.3488: Ralf Rangnick is set to be been named as Manchester United's interim manager, the Athletic and other media outlets reported on Thursday.
Description.3531: The coach of the Chicago Red Stars resigned Sunday, a day after leading his team to the National Women's Soccer League title game and a day before a Washington Post report alleged that players had accused him of verbal and emotional abuse.
Description.3536: Manchester United started life without Ole Gunnar Solskjaer with a 2-0 victory against Villarreal on Tuesday courtesy of goals from Cristiano Ronaldo and Jadon Sancho.
Description.3550: Within hours of Manchester United announcing the sacking of manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, the hashtag 'ThankYouOle' started trending.
Description.3551: Manchester United have confirmed the departure of manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, one day after the club suffered a humiliating 4-1 Premier League defeat at Watford.
Description.3610: Manchester City defender Benjamin Mendy has been charged with two additional counts of rape by the Cheshire Constabulary, the Crown Prosecution Service announced on Tuesday.
Description.3703: Eddie Howe has been named Newcastle United's new Head Coach on a two-and-a-half-year deal until the summer of 2024, the English Premier League club announced in a statement on Monday.
Description.3704: Kim Little scored twice as Arsenal thrashed West Ham United 4-0 on Sunday to make it six wins from six FA Women's Super League games and keep the Gunners top of the standings.
Description.3711: Barcelona squandered a three-goal league lead against Celta Vigo on Saturday as the club's disappointing form continued.
Description.3726: Manchester United slumped to a fourth defeat of the Premier League season at Old Trafford on Saturday, going down 2-0 against rival Manchester City.
Description.3734: Antonio Conte got a crash course in what he can expect as Tottenham Hotspur's new manager after the Italian's first game in charge ended in a 3-2 home victory over Vitesse Arnhem in the Europa Conference League on Thursday.
Description.3753: Liverpool put in a dominant performance against Atlético Madrid on Wednesday night, winning 2-0 in a heated encounter at Anfield in the Champions League.
Description.3760: Real Madrid became the first team in Champions League/European Cup history to score 1,000 goals.
Description.3765: A late Cristiano Ronaldo goal salvaged a dramatic point for Manchester United on Tuesday as it drew 2-2 against Atalanta in the Champions League at the Gewiss Stadium.
Description.3798: Manchester City defender João Cancelo said on Thursday he was assaulted during a burglary at his family home which left the Portuguese international with visible facial injuries.
Description.3801: Typically, the New Year is welcomed with the promise of hope and change, yet the Premier League title race looks set to run an increasingly familiar course -- Manchester City winning at a canter.
Description.3808: Jürgen Klopp was left bewildered by his side's poor performance as Liverpool's Premier League title hopes were dealt a bitter blow by a 1-0 defeat at Leicester on Tuesday night.
Description.3815: Substitute Edinson Cavani scored in the second half to help Manchester United salvage a 1-1 draw at struggling Newcastle United in the Premier League on Monday.
Description.3817: Anthony Martial has asked to leave Manchester United but there have been no offers for the French forward and the club may need to hold onto him if the squad is hit by injuries or more COVID-19 issues, interim manager Ralf Rangnick said.
Description.3825: It's a commonly held view that football is nothing without fans, but as the Premier League enters the traditional hectic Christmas and New Year period, supporters of the 20 top-flight clubs are left with the dilemma of whether to keep cheering on their teams in packed stadiums against the backdrop of the rapid spread of the Omicron variant.
Description.3834: The Premier League has been forced to postpone two matches scheduled for Boxing Day due to Covid-19 issues within Leeds United and Watford.
Description.3839: The fight against discrimination in football is being fought on many fronts -- by individuals, teams and governing bodies. Premier League club Chelsea is no different.
Description.3847: The UK's advertising regulator has labeled two promotions for fan tokens by Arsenal as "irresponsible," ruling they were misleading customers over the risks of investing in cryptocurrencies and warned the English Premier League club that they mustn't appear again.
Description.3867: The seeming inconsistency in the use of VAR over the weekend has raised questions about the standard of officiating in the English Premier League.
Description.3875: Manchester City extended its lead at the top of the Premier League to four points with a 4-0 hammering of relegation-threatened Newcastle United.
Description.3880: The English Premier League match between Aston Villa and Burnley has been postponed due to an increased amount of positive Covid-19 test results within Villa's squad, the club announced on Saturday.
Description.3899: Manchester United announced on Thursday that its English Premier League home fixture against Brighton, which was to be played on Saturday, has been postponed due to "the number of players and support staff having to isolate due to Covid-19".
Description.3926: Tuesday's Premier League fixture between Brentford and Manchester United has been postponed due to a Covid-19 outbreak within the United squad as the league grapples with a surge in cases.
Description.3980: The Arizona Coyotes of the National Hockey League could potentially be without access to their home arena later this month if delinquent taxes and back rent aren't paid, according to a letter sent to team ownership from Glendale city manager Kevin Phelps.
Description.3986: Sam Kerr knocked a pitch invader to the ground on Wednesday evening during Chelsea's 0-0 draw with Juventus in the Women's Champions League and was shown a yellow card for it afterwards.
Description.4000: Atlético Madrid beat Porto 3-1 in a bad-tempered clash to steal a place in the knockout stages of the Champions League.
Description.4027: Ralf Rangnick's first game in charge of Manchester United ended in a 1-0 victory against Crystal Palace on Sunday.
Description.4052: Manchester United bounced back from conceding one of the most unusual goals you're ever likely to see to eventually beat Arsenal 3-2 in Thursday's Premier League clash.
